bibl.title: Letter from Lunsford D. Fricks to W.S. Rankin, October 30, 1922

div1.p: Fricks sends Rankin and Carter a copy of proposed impounded water health regulations.

div1.head: Letter from Lunsford D. Fricks to W.S. Rankin, October 30, 1922
div1.opener:
N. M. C.
meeting
COPY
HEADQUARTERS:
Field Investigations of Malaria
U. S. Public Health Service,
Memphis, Tenn.
October 30, 1922.
I. Waters
Impounded Waters
Dr. W. S. Rankin,
State Health Officer,
Raleigh, North Carolina.
Dear Doctor:
div1.p:
Under date of November 21, 1919, Dr. H. R. Carter,
as Secretary of the National Malaria Committee, prepared a
very complete statement relative to the importance of “man-
made” malaria in the South dealing particularly with (1)
drainage projects, (2) highway construction, (3) new con-
struction of railroads, and (4) impounded waters. On Decem-
ber 26th, 1919, this letter was sent to all the state health
officers of the South with the request that it be given their
careful consideration. In this letter definite suggestions
were made relative to regulations for the governing of drain-
age projects to the end that malaria might not be increased
thereby.

In regard to impounded waters, Dr. Carter stated
that while provisions should be made under the authority of
the state board of health to minimise the production of
malaria-bearing mosquitoes by impounded water projects
he would not at that time attempt to formulate regulations
for these projects.

In October 1920 the Federal Power Commission re-
quested that the Public Health Service furnish a draft of
suggested regulations governing impounded waters, copy of
which is herewith inclosed for your information. It is
believed that the matter of regulations governing impounded
waters is of great and increasing interest to the health
officials of the South.

Will you kindly give this entire matter your
consideration and advise me whether you think it proper to
bring it up for discussion at our next meeting at Chattanooga?
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, L. D. Fricks, Secretary,
NATIONAL MALARIA COMMITTEE,
Surg., In Charge, F.I.-Malaria. c c: Dr H R Carter
FOR YOUR INFORMATION
